titles.title: To amend the Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010 to repeal the authority of the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection to restrict arbitration, and for other purposes.
To amend the Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010 to repeal the authority of the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection to restrict arbitration, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

bill.summary: This bill amends the Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010 to repeal the authority of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau to restrict the use of an agreement between a financial product or service provider and a consumer providing for arbitration of any future dispute between the parties.
